timeline.bodyText: I don't think this is quite right.  The flag should be set based on whether we're in the control plane listener OR the inter-broker listener.  It's much more common to use a separate inter-broker listener, than to use a fully separate control plane listener.

replies.author: abbccdda

replies.bodyText:
From the above:

if we have a control plane listener, the privileged listener is that one, and only that one
otherwise, if we have inter-broker listeners, only those are privileged,
otherwise, all listeners are privileged

We should have this in the JavaDoc for SocketServer

How about privilegedListener?  Then we could add a comment explaining what that means:

if there is a control plane listener, only it is privileged
otherwise, if there is an inter broker listener, only it is privileged
otherwise, all listeners are privileged
